title: Gang busted: 3 arrested, 20 stolen bikes retrieved
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP):Islamabad Capital Police Aabpara Police team have arrested three members of an inter-provincial bike lifter gang involved in numerous bike theft activities and recovered twenty stolen motorbikes and arms along with ammunition from his possession.
An ICP public relations officer said on Tuesday that, following the special directions of Deputy Inspector General (DIG) Islamabad Police Syed Ali Raza the Islamabad Capital Police had categorically started a crackdown against criminal elements in order to save the precious lives and property of citizens.
Following these directions, the Aabpara Police team used technical and human resources and succeeded in apprehending three members of an inter-provincial bike lifter gang involved in numerous bike-lifting activities.
The accused was identified as Abdul Hameed, Didar and Amjad Riaz.
Police team also recovered Stolen twenty motorcycles and arms along with ammunition from his possession. He said other facilitators of the accused will also be arrested soon.
DIG Police Syed Ali Raza said the accused will be challaned to the court with concrete evidence and will be punished.
“Protection of life and property of citizens is the first responsibility for which Islamabad Police is always engaged” he added.
